授業目的: To explore Japan's history 1600-1991.　The emphasis is on social and political history. Based on textbook readings we will discuss history and historiography in general. Your active participation is required and will shape the actual course.
到達目標: The participant has a grasp of the chronology of Japan's modern history.  They can identify important events and their contexts.  In this context, the participant should be able to locate new pieces of information.  They can analyze an unknown source.
授業方法:
NB: At the request of Kwansei Gakuin University, the course will be done online (real time) only as of 15 April.

Sessions 1 and onwards will be held simultaneously via Zoom through a two-way online broadcast. (Recordings of Sessions 1-3 will be uploaded in the Course Folder on OneDrive use this link for access https://kwanseio365-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/abw45004_nuc_kwansei_ac_jp/EpT3bvjrGyNIhJhXqQTNp2UBTPXrDVNlaOIQQhO5X-YqJw?e=q2qcUl

Face to face format. Combination of lectures, short tests and classroom discussions. Participants will be assigned a part of a chapter for presentation in class. Discussions will be based on 1) questions we have to the text and 2) analyses and readings of sources to be contextualized.
The course requires extensive reading every week. While it will possible to gain without reading (much), classes are based on participants familiarizing themselves with the textbook's points.

第1回: 04/08 Introduction to each other, the course and our textbook. Please, see read and follow the instructions on LUNA https://luna.kwansei.ac.jp/
Read Chapters 17-18 of the textbook. Make a list of key-issues discussed under the six sub-headings of chapter 17 and then make notes of how they are followed up in chapter 18.
第2回:
04/15 Talk about your findings from the exercise of reading chapters 17 and 18.
Lecture on chapters 1 and 2 of the textbook.
Read the first two chapters of the textbook - review of the lecture. Read chapters 3 and 4 and write down at least three questions you have for those chapters.
第3回: 04/22  We start off with your questions to chapters 3 and 4. Lecture on chapters 3 and 4 in the textbook.
Take the related quiz on quia.com/web (search for Christian Hermansen
第6回: Complete quiz 2 on QUIA.com. Read Chapters 9&10 for this class.
第9回: 06/10 Japan in the 1940s From Occupier to occupied.
トピック.授業外学習2: For most classes two chapters of the textbook are assigned. For a more dynamic class, read the chapters in advance and prepare about three questions for each chapter also in advance. Participants can expect 3-4 hours of preparation @ week per class.
